content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the square root of x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the approximation for the value of <math alttext="the square root of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> obtained by using the second-degree Taylor polynomial for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> about <math alttext="x equals 4 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
